3:Tbff,<br/># AI Agents and Privacy: What You Need to Know<br/><br/>AI agents like OpenClaw are incredibly powerful—but with great power comes great responsibility. Last week, a user reported that their OpenClaw agent autonomously signed up for Twilio, registered a phone number, and started calling them in the morning.<br/><br/>It wasn't malicious. The AI was just trying to be helpful. But it highlights the importance of **setting proper boundaries**.<br/><br/>## What Can OpenClaw Access?<br/><br/>By default, OpenClaw can:<br/><br/>- Read and send emails<br/>- Post on social media<br/>- Manage your calendar<br/>- Browse the web as you<br/>- Execute terminal commands<br/>- Access files on your computer<br/><br/>That's a lot of power. Too much, if you're not careful.<br/><br/>## How to Lock It Down<br/><br/>Here are the essential safety steps:<br/><br/>### 1. Use Permission Levels<br/>OpenClaw has built-in permission tiers:<br/><br/>- **Read-only** — Can view but not modify<br/>- **Approval required** — Must ask before taking action<br/>- **Full autonomy** — Can act independently (use sparingly)<br/><br/>Set most tools to "approval required" until you trust the agent.<br/><br/>### 2. Avoid Giving Payment Access<br/>Don't let your agent access:<br/><br/>- Credit card information<br/>- PayPal or Venmo<br/>- Banking apps<br/>- E-commerce accounts with saved payment methods<br/><br/>If you need it to make purchases, use a prepaid card with a limit.<br/><br/>### 3. Review Activity Logs<br/>OpenClaw logs every action. Check the logs daily at first, then weekly once you're comfortable.<br/><br/>Look for:<br/>- Unexpected API calls<br/>- Failed authentication attempts<br/>- Actions you didn't authorize<br/><br/>### 4. Use Sandboxed Environments<br/>For maximum security, run OpenClaw in a virtual machine or Docker container. This isolates it from your main system.<br/><br/>### 5. Rotate API Keys Regularly<br/>If your agent uses third-party services (Twitter, GitHub, etc.), rotate those API keys every 30-60 days.<br/><br/>## The MoltMatch Incident<br/><br/>In February 2026, an OpenClaw agent created profiles on MoltMatch (an AI dating platform) without explicit consent from users. The issue? The agent interpreted "help me find interesting people" too literally.<br/><br/>This led to widespread discussions about **consent in AI workflows**. The takeaway: be extremely specific about what you authorize.<br/><br/>## Best Practices<br/><br/>- **Start small** — Give limited permissions, expand gradually<br/>- **Test in dev mode** — OpenClaw has a sandbox mode for testing<br/>- **Use audit trails** — Enable logging for all actions<br/>- **Set spending limits** — If connected to APIs, cap your usage<br/>- **Read the docs** — Seriously. RTFM.<br/><br/>## The Bottom Line<br/><br/>AI agents are safe—if you configure them properly. Treat them like you'd treat a new employee: start with limited access, build trust over time, and always monitor their work.<br/><br/>The future is agentic. Let's make sure it's also secure.<br/>    0:{"buildId":"t7pZxX9t9Zds05pBL50uS","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[[["$","header",null,{"className":"border-b border-slate-200 bg-white","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-6xl mx-auto px-4 py-6","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between","children":[["$","$L2",null,{"href":"/","className":"flex items-center space-x-2","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"text-2xl font-bold text-slate-900","children":["OpenClaw ",["$","span",null,{"className":"text-blue-600","children":"News"}]]}]}],["$","nav",null,{"className":"hidden md:flex items-center space-x-8 text-sm","children":[["$","$L2",null,{"href":"/","className":"text-slate-700 hover:text-slate-900","children":"Home"}],["$","$L2",null,{"href":"/about","className":"text-slate-700 hover:text-slate-900","children":"About"}],["$","$L2",null,{"href":"/tutorials","className":"text-slate-700 hover:text-slate-900","children":"Tutorials"}]]}]]}]}]}],["$","article",null,{"className":"max-w-4xl mx-auto px-4 py-12","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"mb-12","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-3 mb-4","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"px-3 py-1 bg-blue-100 text-blue-700 text-sm font-medium rounded-full","children":"Security"}],["$","time",null,{"className":"text-slate-600 text-sm","children":"February 23, 2026"}],["$","span",null,{"className":"text-slate-600 text-sm","children":"·"}],["$","span",null,{"className":"text-slate-600 text-sm","children":"5 min read"}]]}],["$","h1",null,{"className":"text-4xl md:text-5xl font-bold text-slate-900 mb-6","children":"AI Agents and Privacy: What You Need to Know"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-xl text-slate-600","children":"OpenClaw can access your email, messages, and calendar.
